reviews.sentence: New years eve in ATL. The hotel overall was a good choice as far as location for everything. But when u pay a certain amount you would expect everything to be in your room we had no microwave in the room then house keeping did not come back to our room to clean up on Jan 1st after we told them to come back. Then I had an extra 90 charge on my card and called the hotel and they were unsure. I would not re book.

Close and affordable. We stayed here over the New Years Holiday when we attended the Peach Bowl. It is located just north of downtown on a major freeway. The access is a little strange requiring you to run down a feeder road and turn back toward the hotel. Other than that the hotel was a good value. Clean and well appointed. We were able to get the Georgia Dome in 10 minutes which was great. Right next door to the Hotel is the Silver Skillet. It is a famous breakfast place that has had several movies and TV series filmed there. The food is classic southern food but the best part are the waitresses. I was called darling babe an sugar more times than I could count.

Excellent location for GA Tech Events. Visiting Atlanta for the 2015 ACC Swimming and Diving Championships. Hotel conveniently located to Georgia Tech Campus West of Rt85 midtown within 5 minutes of Aquatic Complex and main part of campus Did not have to deal with Atlanta rush hour traffic.

Excellent location for GA Tech Events. Visiting Atlanta for the 2015 ACC Swimming and Diving Championships. Hotel conveniently located to Georgia Tech Campus West of Rt85 midtown within 5 minutes of Aquatic Complex and main part of campus Did not have to deal with Atlanta rush hour traffic.

Mixed Bag. Stayed last month for an athletic event. Great location conveniently located to GA Tech facilities. Front desk staff Raven was very friendly and check in out was very easy. They were happy to accommodate an early check in so we could drop our luggage before our days events started. Got a very good package block rate that was very competitive. Room was nicely appointed but the walls are paper thin. I could hear the person in the next room clearing her throat. Our rate included breakfast we were down there by 710 opens at 7 on Sunday but there were only 2 bottles of the included juice left not a great flavor and they had no more. Feel sorry for anyone who came down a little later. We also accidentally left something in the room. Called the next day but I had to leave a message for housekeeping. Left my name room number phone number and a detailed description of the item asking for return call to make arrangements to get the item mailed to me. Never heard a word.

Great location near Ikea and Atlantic Station. Girls weekend great location near Ikea and Atlantic Station. Shuttle not operating on weekend but taxi ride only 16 from Atlantic Station to Hotel. Parking 20 seems high for a courtyard. Has a small bar area no real restaurant bar area to speak up just to grab a snack or a beer. Rooms very comfortable and quiet.

Great Location Good Price. This location is a ten minute walk or less for driving to the nearest Marta station. They have really great breakfast on the weekends and free shuttle service during the week. I would definitely stay here again. The staff is very helpful and made me feel at home.

Standard Room Excellent Perks. I stayed at the Courtyard Atlanta Midtown for a workshop at Georgia Tech. The campus is just up the street from the hotel and I walked. it was about a mile to my destination. On the outside the hotel looks ok. it is right off the highway and I was concerned about noise pollution. Parking is not complementary unles you are a Platinum member. Otherwise it was 20 day I think. Once inside however I was more impressed. The actual courtyard area is by a rock face which works as a sound buffer. It was quiet and inviting. The touch screen in the lobby had a lot of local information and the front desk was ready with recommendations. My room was ok standard Mariot room and bed. I liked that there was a refrigerator in my room for leftovers. What really stood out for me was the staff and the perks. This Courtyard provides a free shuttle to any destination in a two mile radius of the hotel which includes the Georgia Aquarium and the World of Coke. My shuttle driver was knowledgeable about restaurants and attractions and I was very happy with the service. it is a great idea for those who do not have their own transportation or do not know the area that well. Big con for me No complementary coffee in the lobby. I know you can make coffee with those powder packets in your room but it is not the same thing. With the Courtyard chain it is all Starbucks now and I miss being able to get coffee like at other Mariot properties.

Braves baseball game with family. This was a weekend getaway with family and we were treated very nicely. Location to midtown was great and checking in was very courteous and professional. Had a great experience and everybody we can in contact were extremely nice. Would stay there again.

hotel is good. the staff helped me in getting my dinner on the first day when i arrived post midnightthe staff did not tell me about the hotel shuttle that can take a person to locations within a 3mile radius of hotel.

This is not the closest hotel to Georgia Tech. We were here for a Georgia Tech visit and from the name thought this was close. It is really not. It is not near any food or restaurants you need to go a mile to Atlantic Station. No shuttle on the weekends so weird to get there. Too short for Uber too long to walk in nice clothes or at night. So this is not the hotel to stay in for Georgia Tech it is not really walking distance. About a mile to Atlantic Station not a horrible walk. Shuttle does NOT run at all on the weekends. Weird.
Not the nicest Courtyard I have stayed in. Location is difficult to get to get picked up from or dropped off at. Amenities are standard for Courtyard but the rooms feel dingy.
Mattress is not too comfy but location is nice and convenient for foodies.

Not a good choice. This hotel is average and has many flaws that make it not worthwhile. Despite being located in midtown it is on the other side of midtown divided by the highway. There is nothing in the immediate vicinity of the hotel except the Georgia Tech campus. Everything is a 5 mile walk away at a minimum. This includes simple things like restaurants. Despite being in the middle of Atlanta this hotel makes you feel like you are in the middle of nowhere. They do offer a shuttle service at times. Parking Here is awful. Despite having a huge empty lot the hotel charges 20 for parking. Even for visitors. There are other hotels with comparable rates that are much closer to attractions and have parking at least on the street. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean I suppose it is just standard. Stay some place else if you can.

Excellent customer service. Loved the comfy beds. Did like the shuttle bus service even though we did have a issue trying to get a pick up and the driver never answered the phone. Staff extremely friendly and excellent service provided.

This hotel in centrally located to the city and the interstate. It was clean and the customer service was awesome. Be aware that the hotel is located right next to the interstate so if you are a light sleep this may affect your rest. They do provide ear plugs in the room though.

Downtown close to Georgia Tech. Awesome experience. Easily accessible to Georgia Tech and Atlantic Station. We ate at a restaurant in Atlantic Station called Yard House. It was excellent. It was raining in Atlanta so we opted to use Uber for transportation. Smart idea and very pleasant with the Uber service we received. very clean very comfortable friendly staff.

Would stay again. The hotel and room are nicely decorated. Very clean and the staff was very personable. Coffee bar offered meals and sandwiches but had limited hours. It closed at 10 am and reopens later on. You can walk to other eateries. I would request a room facing the back of the hotel because the front can get noisy with the highway there. Also heard somebody complain that their room was close to elevator. and it was loud all night. My only complaint was the info given by the front desk about the shuttle. One day I was told it goes to airport. Next day I was told it does n’t but will take you to the Marta Atlanta ’s transit system train. They said to come down at 759am if you want to leave at 80am. We got down at 812 and was told the shuttle would be back at 830am. We ended up walking the half mile to the station. Not horrible but the person at the front desk could not give us directions and did n’t know anything about the trains. Atlanta has four lines and two of them go from the station nearest the hotel to the airport so it is n’t too complicated. She did n’t know what lines go to the airport. It is n’t a complicated systemWould still recommend hotel.

Looking for a walkable hotel. Book somewhere else. This was not my first visit to Atlanta but it was my first visit to this hotel. It was your average Courtyard. nothing stood out about the room or the property. This is fine enough if you are looking for someplace clean to spend the night but I would n’t recommend it to anyone who ’s on a vacation where the are looking to relax. It was a GIANT pain to get in and out of the hotel. Lots of traffic and my Uber drivers all had trouble when th the parking lot. You have to take a ticket to pull up in front of the hotel. You ’re at the side of the interstate there really is n’t anywhere worthwhile to walk to either. If this is the best deal you can find I suppose it ’s ok but there are much better locations to stay in Atlanta.
